data.question: What is the main application of metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) discussed in the text?
data.answer: The main application of MOFs discussed is for non-thermal chemical separations, specifically for the separation of hexane isomers.

data.question: What is the role of the 3D linker in the zinc-based MOF?
data.answer: The 3D linker enhances the structural stability and provides well-defined pore apertures/channels with sub-Ångstrom precision for the separation of hexane isomers.

data.question: What is the significance of using a 3D linker in MOFs for hydrocarbon separations?
data.answer: Using a 3D linker in MOFs allows for precise control over the pore size and aperture, enabling the separation of molecules based on subtle differences in their kinetic diameters.

data.question: Is NU-2200 stable at high temperatures?
data.answer: Yes, NU-2200 is stable up to 350 °C under air and up to 450 °C under N2.

data.question: What is the BET area of NU-2200?
data.answer: The BET area of NU-2200 was calculated to be 355 m2/g.

data.question: How does NU-2200 achieve separation of hexane isomers?
data.answer: NU-2200 achieves separation of hexane isomers through kinetic diffusion limitation or molecular sieving, based on the precise control of pore size and limited flexibility.

data.question: Does NU-2200 maintain its porosity after activation at high temperatures?
data.answer: True, NU-2200 maintains its porosity even after activations at high temperatures up to 400 °C.

data.question: What is the experimental pore volume of NU-2200?
data.answer: The experimental pore volume of NU-2200 is 0.13 cm3/g.

data.question: Can NU-2200 selectively separate linear isomers from monobranched and dibranched isomers?
data.answer: Yes, NU-2200 can selectively separate linear isomers from monobranched and dibranched isomers.

data.question: What is the highest uptake isomer by NU-2200 in single-component sorption isotherms?
data.answer: The highest uptake isomer by NU-2200 in single-component sorption isotherms is nC6.

data.question: What is the role of zinc nitrate hexahydrate in the synthesis of NU-2200?
data.answer: Zinc nitrate hexahydrate acts as a source of zinc in the solvothermal synthesis of NU-2200.

data.question: Does the presence of 3D linkers in NU-2200 minimize dynamic variation of pore aperture?
data.answer: True, the presence of 3D linkers within NU-2200 minimizes the dynamic variation of pore aperture due to linker rotation.

data.question: What is the kinetic diameter of nC6?
data.answer: The kinetic diameter of nC6 is 4.3 Å.

data.question: How does NU-2200's pore size affect its separation performance?
data.answer: NU-2200's precisely controlled pore size allows for the separation of molecules based on their kinetic diameters, enhancing its separation performance.

data.question: Is the separation of C6 isomers into linear, monobranched, and dibranched possible at room temperature using NU-2200?
data.answer: True, the separation of C6 isomers into linear, monobranched, and dibranched is possible at room temperature using NU-2200.

data.question: What is the role of DMF in the synthesis of NU-2200?
data.answer: DMF acts as a solvent in the solvothermal synthesis process of NU-2200.

data.question: Does NU-2200 show a Type-I isotherm in N2 sorption measurements?
data.answer: True, NU-2200 shows a Type-I isotherm in N2 sorption measurements, indicating it is an ultramicroporous material.

data.question: What is the space group of NU-2200?
data.answer: The space group of NU-2200 is P2/c.

data.question: How does the incorporation of 3D linkers affect the thermal stability of NU-2200?
data.answer: The incorporation of 3D linkers increases the structural rigidity of NU-2200, contributing to its enhanced thermal stability.

data.question: Can NU-2200 selectively uptake nC6 from a mixture of all five C6 isomers?
data.answer: True, NU-2200 can selectively uptake nC6 from a mixture of all five C6 isomers, demonstrating its ability to separate linear isomers from the mixture.
